page.title: 17Irvine's Flora and Fauna
page.content: On the 3rd of June we took a bus trip to the eastern corner of{Eglinton} {Park}which lies within our D Block. We took a walk which lasted for about 45 minutes and searched for as much{Flora {and Fauna}as we could find as we went along. We have a moderate climate with more than average rainfall. The soil is fertile so we are lucky to have many plants and healthy woodland growing in our area. Below is our list of{insects}and on the following pages are our lists of other{Flora and {Fauna. { INSECTS: {Horsefly Common fly {Froghopper Grasshopper {Wasp and Bee Cabbage White Butterfly {Dragonfly Tortoiseshell Butterfly {Ladybird Wolf Spider {Water mites Moth and Ant.
